answers.answer: You should talk to your doctor about his risks post surgery. But high blood sugar does not cause "blood clots". If this is the first time he has had high blood sugar readings you need to do follow up to see if he has diabetes. Traumas like surgery can raise blood sugar but those numbers are not in the normal range and should be followed up on with an A1C (average blood sugars for the last couple months)

question: Hi, my husband just had arthroscopic knee surgery done this week and also found out he has high blood sugar between 160-170. Are there any chances of him developing a blood clot post surgery? thanks.
